alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rensselaer; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 2:35AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A BAND OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF EASTERN RENSSELAER...SOUTHERN WASHINGTON...EASTERN WINDHAM...WESTERN WINDHAM...AND BENNINGTON COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of moderate to heavy snow showers accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile briefly. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 232 AM EST, a band of heavy snow was near Hoosick Falls moving east at 35 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE NEAR... Shaftsbury around 240 AM EST. Bennington around 250 AM EST. Stamford around 300 AM EST. Readsboro around 310 AM EST. Monroe and Wilmington around 315 AM EST. Guilford Center around 330 AM EST. Snowfall accumulations of a dusting to an inch are possible. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
